Description: Heavily corroded iron trident spear-head with a wrapped socket, one lateral prong missing. Traces of two symmetric barbs, broken and missing, are visible on each side of the central prong between the lateral branches and the socket.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell Dafana, "Qasr", east annex (C), chamber 19 A
Curator's comments: W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 77 § 77, pl. xxxvii, 3: "The bident (fig. 3) may be perhaps for fishing, or it may be the butt of a spear like the bronze tridents of Nebesheh".
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 77 § 77, p. 110, pl. xxxvii, 3)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.46, p.76, p.185, pl.27)
